body_html:
Hi, @dylanrandle
Here is the explanation I found on StackOverflow: How to interpret Poolallocator messages in tensorflow?
Yes it first says:

These messages should only be a cause for concern if you run out of memory. In such a case the log messages may help diagnose the problem.

But it also says:

Note also that peak execution speed may only be attained after the memory pools have grown to the proper size.

So personally I think the speed will keep low if the PoolAllocator still pop up. What do you think?
BTW, the PoolAllocator disappeared after you reduced your sequence length? Or, it still pops up but the speed became high? Thanks!
body_text:

Here is the explanation I found on StackOverflow: How to interpret Poolallocator messages in tensorflow?
Yes it first says:

These messages should only be a cause for concern if you run out of memory. In such a case the log messages may help diagnose the problem.

But it also says:

Note also that peak execution speed may only be attained after the memory pools have grown to the proper size.

So personally I think the speed will keep low if the PoolAllocator still pop up. What do you think?
BTW, the PoolAllocator disappeared after you reduced your sequence length? Or, it still pops up but the speed became high? Thanks!
body:
Hi, @dylanrandle 
Here is the explanation I found on [StackOverflow: How to interpret Poolallocator messages in tensorflow?](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/35151207/how-to-interpret-poolallocator-messages-in-tensorflow/35166985#35166985)
Yes it first says:
> These messages should only be a cause for concern if you run out of memory. In such a case the log messages may help diagnose the problem. 

But it also says:
> Note also that peak execution speed may only be attained after the memory pools have grown to the proper size.

So personally I think the speed will keep low if the `PoolAllocator` still pop up. What do you think?
BTW, the `PoolAllocator` disappeared after you reduced your sequence length? Or, it still pops up but the speed became high? Thanks!
